 We are Market Partner
 
*Market Partner is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome to our community regardless of who you are, no matter where you come from, or what you look like.*

title: IT Architect
description:
**I rollen får du:** 




 • Driva och vidareutveckla IT arkitekturen på ATG
 



 • Stödja verksamheten och IT med att ta fram hållbara och stabila lösningar
 



 • Bidra och driva framtagandet av mål arkitektur, strategiska tekniska planer och taktiska anpassningar
 



  





 Som IT Arkitekt hos oss får du möjlighet att maximera effekten av vår digitala transformation. Du ansvarar för att skapa lösningsalternativ och utföra konsekvensanalyser för att säkerställa framtidssäkra och hållbara tjänster, produkter och kundupplevelser. Din roll inkluderar att utveckla taktiska och strategiska lösningar, kontinuerligt anpassa produkter efter aktuella och framtida krav, samt se till att lösningarna är skalbara, långsiktiga, och i linje med ATG:s visioner och affärsplan. Du arbetar i en agil organisation tillsammans med utvecklingsteam, ingenjörer, specialister och verksamhetsansvariga för att säkerställa smidig och kostnadseffektiv produktutveckling. En viktig del av din roll är att coacha och säkerställa att målarkitektur och planer är tydliga och förstådda inom organisationen. Vårt team, bestående av sju personer, präglas av öppenhet, motivation och tillit. Under de senaste fem åren har ATG moderniserat sin infrastruktur med en hybridleverans från egna datacenter och molnleverantörer som AWS. Vi har hög automatisering i våra leveranskedjor och strävar efter att hantera allt som kod. Vår standardplattform för nya applikationer är Kotlin/Java/Spring Boot, körda i Kubernetes. För frontend använder vi React, React Native, Redux och Micro Frontend arkitektur.
 



  





**Är det här du?** 




 Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper och för att vara framgångsrik i rollen ser vi att du har en teknisk kunskapsbas. Du behöver tycka om att använda dina kunskaper och erfarenheter för att coacha andra. Som person är du analytiskt och har god problemlösningsförmåga. Vidare är du resultatorienterad och passionerad att driva förändringsarbete. Vi ser att du har ett intresse för såväl det affärsmässiga som det tekniska och kan se situationer ur ett helhetsperspektiv. Du har erfarenhet från medelstora och stora affärssystem och har varit med och drivit förflyttningar och förändringsarbete. Vi söker dig med en god kommunikativ förmåga på både engelska och svenska.
 



  





 Vi ser att du har:
 



 • Erfarenhet av att arbeta som IT Arkitekt, applikationsarkitekt eller liknande inom tekniskt ledarskap.
 



 • Fler års erfarenhet av mikrotjänster, både inom införande och vidareutveckling
 



 • Erfarenhet av messaging ramverk, system och asynkron kommunikation mellan applikationer
 



 • Fler års erfarenhet av transaktionsintensiva system och eventbaserad arkitektur
 



 • Erfarenhet av att definiera icke funktionella krav och kapacitetsplanering
 



 • Erfarenhet av att skapa strategiska roadmap och riktlinjer
 



 • Erfarenhet av analys av prestanda, tillgänglighet och tillförlitlighet inom medelstora affärssystem
 



 • Erfarenhet av att utföra kostnad/värdeanalyser
 



 • Erfarenhet och bra kunskaper inom applikationsarkitektur och infrastruktur (moln och om-prem)
 



 • Övergripande kunskaper eller erfarenhet inom IT-säkerhet, AML och Compliance är ett plus
 



  





**” På ATG får man aldrig tråkigt”** 




 Jag är en målinriktad, kvalitetsmedveten och strukturerad person som brinner för verksamhetsutveckling och för att skapa och vidareutveckla hållbara och framtidssäkra lösningar. Jag har ett holistiskt och pragmatiskt tillvägagångssätt för problemlösning. Som ledare har jag ett stort förtroende för individernas potential och förmågor. Jag trivs bäst i en arbetsmiljö där det händer spännande saker hela tiden och hela organisationen driver mot samma mål och samlas under samma värderingar. Jag brinner för det moderna ledarskapskonceptet och för att hitta smidiga anpassningar mellan organisation och människor, processer och system och jag är ständigt nyfiken på nya utvecklingsmöjligheter. På ATG får man aldrig tråkigt och att driva förändringar är en del av vardagen. På fritiden umgås jag med vänner, lär mig musikteori och läser non-fiktion litteratur. Jag kodar och underhåller även en och annan app.
 



**- Rekryterande chef, Jahan Jahanshahi, Head Of IT Architecture** 




  





**We are the game** 




 I närmare 50 år har vi på ATG levererat spänning och underhållning till svenska folket. Vi drivs av att trygga den svenska hästnäringen och att fortsatt vara ett ansvarsfullt spelbolag i framkant. Vår vision att leverera världens bästa spelupplevelse. Hos oss är du en del av en innovativ miljö – med hjälp av den senaste tekniken utvecklar vi spelupplevelser i världsklass. Självledarskap och kompetensutveckling är viktiga delar för oss. Sedan starten 1974 har vi byggt och förvaltat systemen för våra produkter som hanterar 4 500 000 transaktioner per dag.
 



  





**Join the game!** 




 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan via vår rekryteringsportal antingen med ditt cv eller din LinkedIn-profil – det som är enklast och smidigast för dig. Läs gärna mer om oss på vår karriärsida och tveka inte att höra av dig om du har frågor om tjänsten.
 



 Vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning och gör bakgrundskontroller för alla roller. Tjänsten är på heltid och utgår från vårt kontor vid Solvalla, alldeles intill travbanan. Vi har ett flexibelt arbetssätt vilket innebär att du, beroende på roll, har möjlighet att kombinera distansarbete med arbete från kontoret. Var med och bygg världens bästa spelupplevelse tillsammans med oss!

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:

 Our goal is to be the leading IT consulting company with the most satisfied employees and clients. Here, you don’t work for managers – leadership exists to support you. We put you at the center and aim for your personal and professional development. We trust in our employees' innovative abilities and provide you and your colleagues with the opportunity to expand and deepen your skills.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are currently seeking a Senior Fullstack Engineer with focus on backend engineering to help us develop and expand our genre taxonomy systems. We are looking for someone who understands modern cloud computing and network architecture, and knows how to map technology solutions to business requirements.

title: Cloud Solution Architect: Data Security (Purview, Priva, compliance, etc.)
description:
With over 17,000 employees worldwide, the mission of the Customer Experience & Success (CE&S) organization is to empower customers to accelerate business value through differentiated customer experiences that leverage Microsoft’s products and services, ignited by our people and culture. Come join CE&S and help us build a future where customers achieve their business outcomes faster with technology that does more.
   

  

 We are looking for a Cloud Solution Architect (CSA), specializing in Data Security who is passionate about driving our customers’ security & AI transformation on the Microsoft Platform. This person will be a trusted advisor for customers attempting to secure their entire data estates against internal and external data risk. Microsoft Purview’s integrated Data Security services support customers holistically securing data by Protecting Sensitive Data using data classification, sensitivity labelling and encryption policies. You will be managing Insider Risks using machine learning detection controls and indicators, adaptive protection to dynamically enforce controls and advanced privacy controls. You be responsible for preventing Data Loss using built in exfiltration policies for Microsoft 365 apps, services and endpoints. This is a customer-facing role, owning the technical relationship between the customer and Microsoft, helping customers to leverage their Microsoft investments through architecture, implementation, and operational health engagements.
   

  

 Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* You will drive positive Customer Satisfaction and become a trusted advisor and provide feedback and insights from customers/partners and be the Voice of Customer to share insights and best practices, connect with Global Security teams at Microsoft, Engineering and Product teams to remove blockers and influence the solution roadmap.
* You will land an end-to-end value prop for Security (i.e., Zero Trust) which spans the breadth of Microsoft Security offerings, and with focus on data security (data loss protection, information protection, insider risk management, eDiscovery), ID + Access Management and Cloud Security.
* You will support customers through the adoption lifecycle, through planning, adoption, deployment and optimization as you support increasing drive of Microsoft security products utilization as you lead technical solutioning and nurturing across the customer journey.
* You will deliver technical presentations & demos and propose high-level solutions and work with key Microsoft and Partner resources to drive deployment & customer adoption Identify cross sell/upsell/Unified opportunities through customer engagement.
* You will align your individual skilling to team/area demands and Customer Success goals and accelerate customer outcomes - Share expertise, contribute to IP creation & re-use to accelerate customer outcomes.
* Run Architectural Design Session to build a plan for implementing the solution – governing design in line with customer business goals and their technical environment. Outcome is consensus on solution design and next steps toward production.
* Collaborate and orchestrate with other Cloud Solution Architects and MS stakeholders including FastTrack, partner, and Microsoft Consulting in developing complex end-to-end Enterprise solutions with the Microsoft Security platform.


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business, or related field AND significant experience in cloud/infrastructure technologies, information technology (IT) consulting/support, systems administration, network operations, software development/support, technology solutions, practice development, architecture, and/or consulting
+ OR Master's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business, or related field AND relevant experience in cloud/infrastructure technologies, technology solutions, practice development, architecture, and/or consulting
+ OR equivalent experience

* Relevant experience working in a customer-facing role (e.g., internal and/or external)
* Relevant experience working on technical projects
* Technical Certification in Cloud (e.g., Azure, Amazon Web Services, Google, security certifications)
+ Threat protection, SIEM and Incident Response; Extended Detection and Response (XDR); Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR); Security Operation Center Management; Identity and Access Management; Cloud Infrastructure; Cloud Security; Data Security; Certification in one or more of the following technologies preferred: Microsoft 365 Security Administrator, Microsoft Security Operations, Cloud Security, CCSP, CEH, OSCP, GSEC.


 Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

title: Senior Test Engineer | Digital Experience Platform
description:
**Create moments that matter. Decode the future.**
 Electrolux Group is a leading global appliance company that has shaped living for the better for more than 100 years. We reinvent taste, care and wellbeing experiences for millions of people, always striving to be at the forefront of sustainability in society through our solutions and operations. Under our group of leading appliance brands, including Electrolux, AEG and Frigidaire, we sell household products in around 120 markets every year. In 2023 Electrolux Group had sales of SEK 134 billion and employed 45,000 people around the world.
   

  

 Join us in our exciting quest to build the future home!
   

  

**All about the role:**
 As software is playing an increasingly significant role in enabling digital consumer experiences, we are gearing up to become more agile, faster in responding to market demands and quicker in identifying new market opportunities. This involves elevating our appliances to digital, software-defined products in a seamless integration of modular electronics, software, connectivity platform, and digital services.
   

  

**We’re looking for a Software Test Engineer to join us on our journey.**
**What you'll do:**
 Join a team of software engineers in developing innovative mobile services to enhance the longevity and sustainability of our appliances. Craft outstanding direct-to-consumer sales experiences for three top-tier brands. Whether it's a new filter, spare part, or replacement, you'll be the one to make it easy to purchase.
   

  

**In detail, you will:**
* Ensure that the team understands and delivers the correct product quality for our after sales services and new business models.
* Ship small reliable frequent releases of production grade software together with the rest of the team.
* Develop a modern palette of techniques and methodologies that provides an efficient, risk based, data driven approach to testing.
* Ensure that our software quality is scalable to different brands, and appliance categories in our digital ecosystem.
* Work together with developers, other testers, designers, and product managers with shared responsibility for the teams’ success.
* Make our team be the model for a the new normal in software product testing.


**Who you are:**
* You have 2+ years experience of quality assurance for mobile phone apps, web pages and backend services for consumer users.
* You have experience in testing software applications for full stack products that are frequently updated in production.
* You know how to combine build-time quality tools and run-time quality data for maximizing the testing efforts value.
* You need to master at least two of the following competence areas and quickly learn what good looks like for the others:
* Collaborate with developers in work break down, architecture and design in both long and short horizons to ensure the testability and quality assurance aspect.
* Manual testing of consumer direct interaction services in mobile, web and cloud backends.
* Building modularized test automation for full stack products that provides scalable regression efforts.
* Test automation that simplifies root cause finding for developers.
* Build pipeline, code analysis, feature flag and analytics tools for modern embedded development.


**You demonstrate:**
* Collaboration - contributes to a highly collaborative environment that enables a cross functional team to flourish.
* Communication - effectively exchanges information and ideas with confidence and respect, able to demonstrate progress, raise issues and articulate changes on a frequent basis.
* Empathy - can understand and acknowledge the emotions and perspectives of others during conversations.
* Problem-Solving - able to connect the dots between insights, strategy, and conceptual direction; is outcome - as opposed to task - orientated.
* Adaptability & Resilience - can effectively navigate change, challenges, and setbacks while maintaining a positive and flexible approach.
* Proactivity - eager to learn and grow, sees challenges as opportunities, seeks and - is responsive to - feedback.
* Responsibility - accountable, reliable, and proactive in building systems and handling dependencies, contributing to a trustworthy and effective team dynamic.


**Where you'll be:**
 This is a full-time position, based at our Global Headquarters in Stockholm/Stadshagen (Sweden).
   

  

 At our Global Headquarters in Stockholm/Stadshagen (Sweden) we are 60+ nationalities under the same roof and we enjoy the look and feel of the office!
   

  

 You will be part of a dynamic international team where English is the natural language.
   

  

  

  

 Benefits highlights:
   

  

* Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment
* Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services
* Family friendly benefits
* Insurance policy plan
* Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path


**As part of Electrolux, we will continuously invest in you and your development. There are no barriers to where your career could take you.**
**Find out more on:**
 www.electroluxgroup.com.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
**Company Description** 




 Merkle Sweden - a Dentsu company is a consultancy firm with expertise in the areas of digital analytics and conversion optimization. We help large corporations and organizations collect, interpret, and act on data from their digital touchpoints, such as apps and websites, and use the data to make their communications and marketing efforts more hard-hitting.
 



 Our extensive experience and deep proficiency in Google Analytics 360 and Google Optimize mean that our clients rely on us for their most complex, challenging assignments.
 



  





**Job Description:** 




 Merkle is looking for a driven specialist with a huge interest in data and analytics. You’ll be based in either Gothenburg or Stockholm.
 


* Implement metrics for clients and provide regular analysis.
* Give recommendations for measurement solutions for digital services based on clients’ business and activity goals.
* Maintain and develop a strong know-how of Google Marketing Platform in general and Google Analytics 360 in particular. Other measurement tools may be used.
* Provide insights and recommendations that improve clients’ activities and business.
* Develop data-visualization solutions (in dashboards) that make it possible for clients to follow sales and other important performance indicators in real time.



  





**Qualifications:** 



* Minimum of 3 years’ experience in similar role
* Experience working with large amounts of data and an understanding of SQL and databases.
* In-depth knowledge of working with Google Analytics data, being an advanced user.
* Presentation skills to both large and small groups of varying degrees of knowledge, internally within the Group and also with clients.
* Ability to manage different work tasks and projects and prioritize accordingly as you will be working with several clients and projects at the same time.
* Ability to work with data analysis and provide accurate recommendations based on data.
* Knowledge of data-visualization tools, formal statistics training, and experience with Google Cloud (especially BigQuery) are desirable.
* Good communication skills in Swedish and English, both in speaking and writing.



  





**Some of the Perks We Offer:** 



* We have a collective agreement and attractive benefits. Several years in a row, we have won the DI Gasell Award, won the Mästargasellen Award, and been named a “Superföretag” (Super Company) by Veckans Affärer and Bisnode.
* Friendly, knowledgeable colleagues who like to share their knowledge.
* Possibility to work with multinational companies in a number of different industries, meaning you get a wide range of experience and the chance to work with different data sets.
* Working for a certified reseller of several Google Marketing Platform products and working closely with Google in Sweden, England, Ireland, and the United States. We are the biggest player in the Nordics when it comes to Google Analytics 360.
* Continuous personal development in the form of lab days, groups exchanging experiences, and your own professional development budget.
* The chance to grow both within your area of specialty and within Dentsu, the global network Merkle Northern Europe is a part of.



  





**Inclusion and Diversity:** 




 Our diverse and inclusive culture enables our employees to bring their whole selves to work and be proud of doing so. For us, this is the foundation for great innovation which, in turn, generates better outcomes for our people, partners and communities. This is why we encourage applications from people with disabilities, and of all ages, nationalities, backgrounds and cultures.
 



 We are happy to discuss flexible and agile approaches to working for all our roles – we can’t promise we will be able to offer you everything you want or need but we do promise to discuss it with you openly and honestly. If you have any reasonable adjustment needs arising from a disability or medical condition to fully participate in the recruitment process, please discuss this with our recruitment teams.
 



  





**About dentsu:** 




 Dentsu Group is a global marketing communications company headquartered in Tokyo, Japan. It is one of the largest advertising and media firms in the world. The company offers a wide range of services in advertising, marketing, communication, and digital media, catering to clients across various industries.
 



 We help clients to win, keep, and grow their best customers and achieve meaningful progress for their businesses with the best-in-class services and solutions in media, CXM, and creative. For more information please see: www.dentsu.com.
 



  





**Working with us:** 




 Joining dentsu, you’ll join a team of 72,000 people. It’s an opportunity to produce career-defining work. Along the way, you’ll team up with inspiring colleagues and encounter a richness of clients, cultures, and experiences. We offer exciting challenges, a great working environment, memorable experiences, and opportunities to shape your future.
 



  





**Contact:** 




 We look forward to receiving your application for any questions, please contact the TA in charge of this role: Thomas Holley, Talent Acquisition Partner, EMEA, NE by email at: Thomas.holley@dentsu.com or by phone at: +45 53 84 75 82

title: Project manager for SVT - SVT
description:
**Description**
 ROLE: Project manager
   

  

 Start date: 2024-10-01 (immediately)
   

  

 End date: 2025-09-30
   

  

 OPTION: The call contract may be extended one or more times.
   

  

 PLACE OF STATION: SVT Stockholm mainly, some work can be done remotely, by agreement.
   

  

 SCOPE: 60-100%
   

  

**Description:**
 At SVT Produktion & Teknik, we are looking to appoint a Project Manager/requirement analyst starting in October 2024, to lead initiatives planned within the IT workplace and Business Systems service area. The project manager is expected to lead several initiatives in parallel and reports to appointed steering groups for each project. The project manager will be responsible for and lead the technical migration from the existing database with reporting and follow-up tools to another solution in close collaboration with Finance, Payroll, selected supplier and technical teams. The task includes developing an architecture solution, planning and implementing data migration and implementation of the new reporting tool. It will also include training and relocation of affected operations. The work will be carried out in close dialogue and prioritization with a number of other major transfers within the Finance Department/SVT Finance. There is also ongoing work within HR regarding risk management with a focus on routines and processes, integrations, data quality and organizational structure. The project manager is responsible for, together with HR, Finance and Payroll, planning and carrying out prioritized risk management measures and for developing a solution proposal for a centralized organizational structure. There is a requirement that the consultant can quickly get on track and lead and run assigned projects during the period in a forward-looking and responsive manner and handle both large and small issues.
   

  

**Should Requirements:**
* Language requirements: Swedish
* Technical project management - Experience in leading complex projects with high quality
* Requirements management - Experience and knowledge regarding requirements management and requirements formulation
* Technical understanding - Understanding and experience for cloud-based solutions, databases and migration in the area of business systems such as HR, ERP
* Leadership - Highly independent who can take primary responsibility for leading and coordinating different teams, communicating with stakeholders and management.
* Good knowledge of risk management, GDPR, Microsoft technologies, Agile working methods


**Should Requirements:**
* Experience within Public Service and SVT is meritorious


 Skills: project management skills,business systems,risk management,it,svt

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
Founded in 2018, Kreditz is already the market leader in PSD2 credit scoring products.
   

  

 We use Open Banking/PSD2 technology to create our revolutionizing real-time credit scoring products, which are beloved by banks, financial institutions, gambling companies and many more. Kreditz products enable consumers and businesses to gain financial inclusion and financial opportunities where none would be available with traditional credit scoring systems.
   

  

 Our long-term vision "One world, One score" translates into our everyday mission of financial inclusion, and financial opportunity, for everyone around the globe – Everyone deserves a fair assessment.
   

  

 To fuel our growth to the next level, we recently added 10m EUR of funding from world-renowned investors Creades and Ingka Investments.
   

  

 Come join us on our impactful mission!
   

  

**About The Role**
 Kreditz is on the lookout for a highly skilled and experienced Senior Data Engineer to join our dynamic IT team. In this role, you will be at the heart of our data operations, manage and optimize our MySQL and PostgreSQL databases, design efficient data pipelines, and ensure top-tier data security and integrity. You'll work closely with data scientists, analysts, and architects to support our credit scoring products. Your role also involves monitoring performance, implementing backup and disaster recovery solutions, and ensuring GDPR compliance.
   

  

*Key Responsibilities*
* Optimize database performance, security, and availability.
* Develop and maintain data pipelines and ETL processes.
* Implement data security and disaster recovery measures.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver data solutions


**Who You Are**
 We are seeking a dedicated Data Engineer who thrives in a fast-paced environment, has excellent problem-solving and analytical skills and is passionate about data. You should have:
   

  

* A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
* 5+ years of experience in data engineering, data administration, or a similar role.
* Proven expertise in managing and optimizing MySQL and PostgreSQL databases.
* Strong skills in SQL and scripting for database automation.
* Experience in designing and implementing data pipelines and ETL processes.
* A solid understanding of data governance, quality, and security best practices.
* Strong communication skills in English (Swedish is a plus).


 Experience with FinTech and PSD2 technologies, as well as certifications like AWS Certified Solutions Architect or Azure Solutions Architect, would be advantageous.
   

  

**Why Kreditz?**
 At Kreditz, you’ll have the opportunity to work in a cutting-edge, fast-growing FinTech company that’s redefining the credit scoring industry. With the backing of major investors and a clear vision for the future, your work will make a real impact on financial inclusion worldwide. Join us and be a part of something truly transformative.
   

  

**APPOINTMENT OF ROLE**
 We interview candidates on an ongoing basis (ongoing selection).
   

  

**SCOPE**
 Fulltime
   

  

**REPORTING**
 You will be reporting to the company’s CTO
   

  

**SALARY**
 Monthly salary
   

  

**WORKPLACE**
 Our office is in Danderyd, Stockholm
   

  

**CONTACT**
 For more information about the role feel free to reach out to our Talent Acqusition Specialist, Axel Jeppsson, axel@Kreditz.com

title: Business Applications Developer
description:
**You will be a part of…** 




 ...an international environment with colleagues all around Europe with our headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden. You will join a fast and innovative environment and be a part of a great-positioned company, with even higher ambitions for the future. Scrive is filled with caring, smart and committed people who know that we need to collaborate to win. We care about each other and encourage ourselves and each other in our aim to be better and grow, both as people and as a company. Come join us and be a part of Scrive’s successful journey!
 *🚀* 




  





 We are looking for a Business Applications Developer to our Revenue Operations team. You will be part of a team with two others reporting directly to our Head of Revenue Operations. This is a cross-functional role, where you will collaborate with other departments such as Finance, Data, and Revenue. You’ll work closely with both Operations Specialists and our Salesforce Administrator.
 



  





 You can either be located at our Stockholm Office and work in a hybrid setup (both office and from home), or totally remote if you are located elsewhere.
 



  





**Your challenge** 




 As a Business Applications Developer, you will be responsible for managing and maintaining our billing processes, ensuring seamless integration between Salesforce, PE Accounting and the backend of our product. You will own, manage and continuously develop two key middlewares that are in place to automate our billing and related processes. You will work proactively with improvements and testing to ensure a smooth billing process, a critical part of generating our positive cash flow.
 



  





 In your everyday work, your responsibilities will include:
 


* **Middleware Management:** 
 Own, manage and continue to develop the integration middlewares between Salesforce, PE, and our product backend to fetch usage data and ensure accurate billing.
* **Billing Processes** 
 : Oversee billing processes, ensuring timely and accurate invoicing, reconciliation, and reporting.
* **Salesforce Development** 
 : Own Salesforce development and handle development and administration tasks related to Salesforce. Mostly on Revenue Cloud (CPQ + Billing modules).
* **Solution Architecture:** 
 Own architectural design of business applications - including middlewares, integrations, and Salesforce code base. Ensuring scalability, performance, and security across our application landscape.
* **Custom Integration:** 
 Build the odd custom system integration for when the standard integration doesn’t cut it and ensure data accuracy and consistency.
* **Problem Resolution:** 
 Identify and resolve any issues related to billing, integrations, and system performance.
* **Documentation:** 
 Maintain detailed documentation of billing processes, system configurations, and integration workflows.



  





**Who we think you are** 




 We believe you are a constant improver, able to effortlessly build relationships with anyone at any time. To succeed in this role, you will need:
 


* Minimum 2 years of experience in developing system integrations/middlewares
* Proficiency in at least a few of the following programming languages - JavaScript, Java, C#, SQL, and/or Python is required
* Meticulous attention to detail and accuracy in managing billing processes and system integrations
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams



  





**🌟 Also, big bonus points if you have:** 



* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Finance, or a related field is preferred
* Familiarity with ERPs/Accounting systems, billing processes, and preferably accounting, such as having built these kinds of integrations and/or middlewares before is highly desirable
* Experience with Salesforce development (APEX) and administration is highly beneficial but not required



  





 Don’t meet every single requirement? Apply anyway! Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. We want to build a diverse and inclusive workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we still want to hear from you.
 



  





 In this role we see that you are
 **problem solving** 
 ,
 **structured** 
 ,
 **flexible** 
 and
 **taking initiatives** 
 . We’re using a competence-based recruitment process where those competences will play an important role.

title: Product Owner - Lön
description:
**Vill du vara med och skapa ett bättre företagande för mer än 1500 svenska företag? Välkommen till PE som Product Owner Lön!**
 PE Business Cloud är den tjänst som alla företag hoppas få när de skaffar ett ekonomi- och lönesystem - dvs kontroll och effektivitet med ett användargränssnitt som alla anställda gillar.
   

  

 Idag har fler än 1500 företag redan valt PE och vi växer med mer än 20% per år.
   

  

**Vår produktorganisation**
 På PE är Product och Development två organisationer som jobbar tätt ihop. Produkt-teamet är idag 8 personer (PO och UX) och du rapporterar till Chief Product Officer.
   

  

 Produktägare jobbar i “Squads” med utvecklare som tillsammans i squad:en ansvarar för en uppsättning processer med tillhörande funktioner, flöden, integrationer och dokumentation.
   

  

 Som PO har du kollegor både i produkt-teamet och i din Squad (utvecklare, UX och inlånade domänexperter från vårt payroll-team och från redovisningssidan) som du jobbar nära.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som Produktägare På PE Jobbar Du Nära Våra Befintliga Kunder. Vi Kör Customer Advisory Boards För Större Initiativ Och Som PO Bör Du Bygga Relationer Till Ett Antal Go-to-kunder Som Du Kan Bolla Idéer Med - Kommunikation Är Därför En Viktig Del Av Jobbet. Affärsprocesser Och Funktionalitet Som Rollen Omfattar i Dagsläget
   

  

* Löneberäkning, löneutbetalning, bokföring av lön.
* Verktyg för vårt löneteam som servar våra kunder.
* Verktyg för vårt implementeringsteam som implementerar våra kunder.
* Lönerapportering, dashboards och uppföljning som behövs för att kunderna skall uppleva systemet som källan till insikter och kontroll för allt lönerelaterat.
* Funktionalitet för rapportering till andra aktörer i löne-ekosystemet, exempelvis: Pensionsrapportering till Collectum och Fora, rapporter till Statistiska Centralbyrån, rapporter till Svenskt Näringsliv.
* Integrationer till Skatteverket för FOS och AGI
* Integration till Kivra för leverans av lönespecifikation
* Integration till förmånsportaler och och HR-system
* Lönekartläggningsmodulen
* Implementering av EUs Lönetransparansdirektiv (framtida)


**Förväntningar På Dig i Rollen**
 Du förväntas bli den som kan lönemodulen bäst ur ett användarperspektiv/förmågaperspektiv och bli den som vet mest om hur våra kunders processer kring lön ser ut. Du kommer bli den som utbildar resten av organisationen i lönemodulen och som skapar presentationsmaterial som kunder kan använda för att komma in i produkten. Vidare förväntar vi oss att du:
   

  

* Blir den som sammanväger kunskap om produkten, kunder, konkurrenter och ekosystemet och med den kunskapen planerar vägen framåt för produkten och eventuella kringliggande tjänster.
* Är den personen som vet mest om hur våra konkurrenters erbjudanden och produkter ser ut.
* Projektleder product-lifecycle-projekt som till exempel att migrera över kunder från tidigare lönemotor till vår nya lönermotor i samarbete med kunder, vår konsultorganisation och vårt löneteam i leveransorganisationen.


**Dina kvalifikationer som gör dig till lämplig för rollen:**
 För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du har erfarenhet från Produkt och/eller UX-arbete i B2B-produkter samt erfarenhet från löne-domänen i Sverige. (antingen från att du har jobbat i dessa processer eller att du har byggt produkt för dessa processer). Du är bra på att skapa struktur och ordning i en dynamisk miljö med hög förändringstakt och som person tror vi tror att du är självdriven, nyfiken och envis.
   

  

 Vidare ser vi att du kan strukturera information i ett format som gör det möjligt att kommunicera effektivt med interna och externa personer så att beslut kan fattas och frågor kan drivas till konklusion. Du behöver förstå hur man kommunicerar med säljare, utvecklare, ekonomichefer, VD och grundare och entreprenörer. Det är viktigt att du kan ta initiativ till dialog och kommunikation med både kunder och övriga funktioner på PE.
   

  

**On-boarding till denna tjänst**
 Vi i produkt-teamet hjälper dig in i våra processer och verktyg och vi har en mycket kunnig domänexpert för lön som jobbar i produkt-teamet. Vi har även ett löneteam i vår leveransorganisation som du kommer att jobba nära. Alla POs träffas varje vecka för att dela och lära av varandra och det finns mycket erfarenhet i teamet som kan få dig upp på banan snabbt.
   

  

**Om PE**
 Sedan PE grundades 2011 har bolaget växt till 200+ medarbetare och över 220 MSEK i omsättning. Vi har en stabil affärsmodell, där över 90% av intäkterna är prenumerationsbaserade. Bolagets tillväxt har skett utan externt riskkapital och med sunda finanser. Vi har fått utmärkelsen DI Gasell sex år i rad och är ett värderingsstyrt bolag med stort fokus på glädje, ansvar, prestigelöshet och nyfikenhet!
   

  

 Vi erbjuder stor frihet under ansvar, flexibla arbetstider, balans mellan arbete & fritid, bra förmåner, friskvårdsbidrag, tjänstepension, interna karriärmöjligheter, kompetensutveckling, strukturerade utbildnings- och målsamtal, utbildning varje år, konferenser, AW’s, aktiviteter, mellis, frukt och gratis gym, ett modernt och centralt kontor fullt av hjälpsamma, prestigelösa och kunniga kollegor, och mycket mer.
   

  

 Välkommen till oss!
   

  

**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**
 Heltid, Ort: Stockholm (Fleminggatan 14) eller Göteborg (Kungsgatan 20). Start: Enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Urval & intervjuer kommer att ske löpande, varmt välkommen att skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.
   

  

 Se mer om oss på: accounting.pe/karriar & instagram.com/peaccounting
   

  

 Vi genomför bakgrundskontroller i slutskedet av våra rekryteringsprocesser.
   

  

 Vi på PE Accounting ändrar sättet världen ser på ekonomi- och lönehantering!
   

  

 Vårt automatiserade system, i kombination med vår tjänsteleverans bildar tillsammans en helhetslösning som ger våra kunder möjligheten att outsourca sin ekonomifunktion, och samtidigt behålla 100% kontroll - i realtid.
   

  

 Vi har en stabil affärsmodell, där över 90% av intäkterna är prenumerationsbaserade. Tillväxten har skett organiskt och med sunda finanser. Vi har fått utmärkelsen DI Gasell sex år i rad och är ett värderingsstyrt bolag med stort fokus på glädje, ansvar, prestigelöshet och nyfikenhet!

title: Är du vår nästa Analytics Consultant?
description:
Vi letar nu efter fler kollegor till vår växande grupp datakonsulter; personer som gillar att skapa magi genom data & analys!
   

  

 Våra närmare 200 dataexperter jobbar med datalösningar inom nästan alla teknologier, både med och utan cloud. Ett vanligt projekt varierar i längd från en månad till några år, och situationen kan justeras baserat på dina önskemål. Våra kunder finns inom alla branscher, allt från produktutveckling, hälsa, industri och försäkring till kommunikation, bank och elförsörjning.
   

  

 Såhär beskriver vår Viz-konsult Alexandra sitt nuvarande projekt:
   

  

 “Jag hjälper kunden att utveckla en app för att följa upp kostnader i stora projekt, för att se till att man ligger i linje med budgeten och fakturerar enligt plan. Mitt uppdrag hos kunden kommer att breddas framöver då jag nyligen hjälpt till att göra en kartläggning av Power BI-behov i hela verksamheten. Vi har bland annat hittat behov inom kvalitet och hållbarhetsredovisning – vilket jag tycker är extra spännande då det knyter an till mitt intresse för området. Det bästa med uppdraget är samarbetet – jag är del av ett Scrum-team bestående av bolagets egna it-medarbetare och användare. Det är också tryggt att ha Solitas community i ryggen, jag vet att jag aldrig är ensam, det finns alltid hjälp att få av kollegorna”
   

  

**Känner du igen dig i följande?**
* Du diskuterar gärna datavisualiseringar och databaser, och bygger inspirerande dashboards
* Du kan implementera datalösningar som fungerar både för dataexperter och beslutsfattare på företag
* Du lär dig gärna nya teknologier och metoder
* Du är bekant med och/eller är nyfiken på teknologier som Tableau, Power BI och SQL


 Det viktigaste för oss är ändå att du delar våra värderingar, du är omtänksam mot andra och delar gärna din kunskap och vågar stå för det du tror på. Vår företagskultur är väldigt viktig för oss, och vi värdesätter låg hierarki, självständighet och ansvar, värdeskapande arbete, och trevliga kollegor. Här kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, och här kan du bläddra bland våra tech-bloggar.
   

  

**På Solita Får Du**
* Projekt som skapar riktiga avtryck, både hos kunder och i samhället
* Nya teknologier
* En arbetskultur med hög självständighet och tillit
* Variation: i projekt, i teknologier, i angreppsätt
* Personlig utveckling och möjligheten att lära sig både från erfarna experter och våra interna utbildningssatsningar och communities
* Konkurrenskraftig, fast lön i kombination med bl.a. 30 semesterdagar, fredagsfrukostar, aw:s, bike leasing, inhouse coach, yoga på kontoret, och pensionsavsättningar även under din föräldraledighet


 Blev du nyfiken? Hör av dig till oss!
   

  

***Solita är ett nordiskt företag som jobbar med digital transformation, styrd av data och mänsklig expertis. Vi har kontor i Sverige, Finland, Tyskland, Estland, Belgien och Danmark.***

title: Backendutvecklare Produkt Tur
description:
Vill du vara med på resan mot världens bästa spelupplevelse? Vill du jobba med välkända produkter som Triss, Lotto och Eurojackpot? Kom till Svenska Spels IT-Turprodukter-team med ambitiösa och engagerade kollegor i en miljö som präglas av ny teknik och en stark uppfinnarkultur. Bli vår nästa backendutvecklare!
   

  

**Vad kommer du att göra?**
 Din huvuduppgift kommer att bli backendutveckling med fokus på design och programmering. Du kommer arbeta i ett team som består av tech lead, systemutvecklare, utvecklingsnära testare och en teamcoach. Alla i teamet har till uppgift att skapa smarta, lättanvända, responsiva tjänster inom vår domän IT-Turprodukter. Teamet jobbar nära webbklientteamen som utvecklar våra Tur-produkter såsom Triss, Lotto och Eurojackpot.
   

  

 I din roll så kommer du att ansvara för såväl nyutveckling som förändringar av befintliga funktioner, och bidra till att skapa säkra, kundvänliga lösningar med mycket höga krav på prestanda. Vi jobbar i en inspirerande miljö där utvecklingsteamen har alla förutsättningar att kunna fokusera och vara effektiva. Att trivas på jobbet och ha en balans mellan arbete och fritid är viktigt för oss.
   

  

**Är du den som kommer att göra det?**
 Om du gillar att arbeta i team och är drivande, nyfiken, kundorienterad och har ett intresse av att utvecklas – både personligt och yrkesmässigt, kommer du att trivas hos oss.
   

  

 Vi Vill Att Du Har Minst Några Års Erfarenhet Inom Backendutveckling Och God Kunskap Om Utvecklingsmetodik. Du Är Van Att Jobba Agilt Och Har Framförallt Använt Dig Av
   

  

* C# microservices i molnmiljö (Azure/AWS/GCP)
* Continuous Deployment
* Kubernetes/Docker
* Eventdrivna applikationer (ex. Apache Kafka, Rabbit MQ)
* Enhetstester och integrationstester med ex. SpecFlow


 Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet från, Ruby, PostgreSql, MongoDB, REST-tjänster och RESTful-design. Deploy med Github Actions och Octopus Deploy. Samt fördel med erfarenhet av Asp.net och Entity Framework.
   

  

 Även erfarenhet av monitorering ex. opentelemetry, grafana är en merit.
   

  

**Om Tech på Svenska Spel**
 På Svenska Spel hanterar vi 10 000 000 transaktioner varje dag, året runt och på sex dagar har vi hanterat samma transaktionsvolym som den största pengaöverföringsappen gör på en månad. Varje dag utvecklar, driftar och supportar vi ett av världens mest avancerade spelsystem, vi är med andra ord ett techbolag som sysslar med spel - inte tvärtom. Och som ett techbolag som sysslar med spel kommer ett ansvar, både för folks drömmar och spänning, men även för deras spelande. Det är också därför du kommer märka att vårt spelansvarsarbete genomsyrar hela företaget från första dagen du börjar jobba hos oss.
   

  

**Vi är Svenska Spel**
 Svenska Spel är hela Sveriges spelbolag. Vi skapar hållbara och roliga spelupplevelser som bidrar till ett bättre Sverige. Genom spel som Triss, Stryktipset och Oddset ger vi våra fyra miljoner kunder spänning, glädje och drömmar. Våra spel är enkla och trygga och oavsett om man spelar online eller fysiskt, själv eller tillsammans med andra, så ska upplevelsen alltid vara positiv. Vi vill att fler ska spela hållbart hos oss och vår verksamhet ska bedrivas på ett socialt, ekonomiskt och miljömässigt ansvarsfullt sätt. Varje år går överskottet till statskassan. Vi är Sveriges största idrottssponsor och investerar nära 300 miljoner kronor årligen i svensk idrott. Vi är modiga, nyfikna och strävar efter enkelhet i allt vi gör samt skapar resultat tillsammans.
   

  

 Är du nyfiken på våra förmåner? Då hittar du dem här:
   

  

 https://career.svenskaspel.se/pages/formaner
   

  

  

  

**A** 
**nsökan och kontaktuppgifter**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med placering på något av våra kontor i Visby eller Solna med möjlighet till flexibelt distansarbete. Hela teamet sitter i Visby så det är förstås en fördel om du också gör det.
   

  

***Vi ser fram emot din ansökan redan nu. På grund av semestertider kan återkopplingen dröja lite längre än normalt. Så sök nu! Njut av en sommaren, så hörs vi i så snart vi hunnit kika på din ansökan.***
 För frågor om tjänsten, kontakta Mats Båge, Chef IT-produkter Tur, mats.bage@svenskaspel.se
   

  

 För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta Team Talent Acquisition, teamta@svenskaspel.se

title: ISV Partner Solution Sales
description:
The Global Partner Solutions (GPS) team is a sales organization accountable for the commercial partner business at Microsoft, and the mission is to build and sell Microsoft Cloud applications, services and devices with partners, empowering people, and organizations to achieve more.
   

  

 As a Partner Solution Sales (PSS) for ISVs, we are looking for you to bring your work ethic, enthusiasm, optimism, and passion for the customer to foster growth and change within our partner ecosystem.
   

  

 You will leverage your challenger mindset, sales management skills, technology, and industry knowledge, and best in class interpersonal abilities to enable our partners to bring market-defining solutions to our customers.
   

  

 This job opportunity will allow you to accelerate your career growth as you work with highly complex partner organizations, build strong relationships with partner and Microsoft sales organizations and collaborate across multiple stakeholders to accelerate sales performance,
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 In the Partner Solution Sales for ISVs role;
   

  

* You will collaborate with segment sellers and other internal stakeholders on partner co-selling efforts with a portfolio of assigned ISV partners to drive sales pipeline.
* You will develop and execute co-sell strategies that outline activities and expectations that drive Microsoft and partner sales targets and lead collaboration between internal and external stakeholders to accelerate deal execution, leverage investments, and accelerate sales.
* You will track cloud solution area co-sell pipeline performance and independently addresses low performance through correction of errors (CoE) efforts as well as track partner sales capabilities and capacities for sales practice acceleration and growth and incentive utilization and impact on pipeline velocity and provides recommendations to partner to improve performance while also tracking quarterly forecast to ensure it meets and/or exceeds revenue accountability.
* You will manage top partner deals and overall partner revenue and closely collaborate with other partner facing resources across the GPS organization.
* You will share best practices for co-selling with partners and global peers through community forums, contributes to listening circles and contributes to worldwide learning initiatives as a subject matter expert and share market local solution area business momentum insights and corporate research for customer demand.


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor's Degree in Engineering (e.g., Informatics), Business/Economics (Sales), or related field;
* Proven experience in information technology (IT)-related industry sales, the partner channel sales and professional coaching/mentoring - OR equivalent experience;
* This role requires proficiency in written, reading, and conversational Swedish as you will be assigned to the Swedish Customer Market.


 Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

title: Software Engineering Manager - Ubuntu Linux Kernel
description:
Canonical, the publisher of Ubuntu, is growing its Linux kernel engineering team significantly. We are creating new teams in EMEA, Americas and APAC time zones that work holistically on the Ubuntu kernel and is therefore seeking multiple candidates to lead these new teams. These teams handle upstream development and the expression of new kernel capabilities in Ubuntu, they work with silicon and cloud partners to optimise the Ubuntu kernel for CPUs and hypervisors, they handle CVEs, livepatch and security updates to LTS and current release kernels, and they work with partners to ensure that Ubuntu works first time on every possible piece of hardware.
   

  

 This role would suit either an experienced manager of high performing software development teams, or a very proficient technical lead who is excited to take on a management responsibility. You will need to be passionate about Linux and aspire to be an integral part in it's distribution to millions of users worldwide.
   

  

 As an engineering manager at Canonical, your primary responsibility is to your team: helping them grow as engineers, do important and satisfying work, and have a great time while doing it. Technical leadership experience and a background in software engineering are necessary prerequisites for this role. You will be expected to lead, challenge, and develop strong engineers, positively influence the culture, facilitate technical delivery, and work with your team on strategy and execution.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Working from home, worldwide. We have kernel teams and openings in every time zone and with the notable exception of Taipei, Taiwan, have no offices and therefore no pressure to work from an office.
   

  

 What your day will look like
   

  

* Lead a distributed team of engineers in your time zone
* Develop your team through coaching, mentoring, leading by example, and feedback
* Support timely delivery of core and specialised Ubuntu kernels
* Oversee commercial engagements that require custom kernel engineering
* Ensure an ongoing commitment to strict quality and reliability standards
* Engage with other teams at Canonical, the open source community and commercial partners
* Work from home with travel globally 2-3 times a year for up to two weeks, for internal and external engineering events


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* Significant programming experience in C, with Python, Golang, or other like languages also highly regarded
* Substantial experience with Linux kernel internals and concepts
* Solid understanding Linux kernel development principles
* Demonstrated experience managing or leading a team of software engineers
* Contributed to an open source project in the past
* Understanding of agile software development methodologies
* Ability to communicate effectively in English, both written and oral


 What we offer you
   

  

 Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.
   

  

 In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.
   

  

* Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
* Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Parental Leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
* Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

description:

 to strengthen the consulting team.

title: Engineer III, Field Applications
description:
**Work Schedule**


Standard (Mon-Fri)**Environmental Conditions**


Standing for full shift**Job Description**


Job Description: Engineer III

**Job Title: Field Services Engineer**


When you’re part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work, like helping customers in finding cures for cancer, protecting the environment, or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have a real-world impact, and you’ll be supported in achieving your career goals!

 **Position Summary:**


We are searching for a dedicated Service Engineer to repair, install, and update all Thermo Fisher hardware and automation products under the BEA division, along with consulting at customer sites.

 **Key Responsibilities**

* Provide instruments and equipment services, including installation, basic training, preventative maintenance, repair, and compliance services.
* Chip into high-value service-related procedures and documents.
* Work closely with other departments to improve customer experience.
* Help to cultivate customer satisfaction through ensuring prompt customer response times and problem resolution.
* Provides up-to-date service reporting on customer activities.
* Perform commissioning and qualification of equipment by completing Site Acceptance Test (SAT) and Installation/Operational Qualification (IQ/OQ) Protocols.
* Developing and maintaining positive relationships with customers in assigned territory.
* Help Service Sales Representative on service orders.
* Support product quality improvement.

**Education/experience:**

* Bachelor’s degree or above, major in computer technology, E/E, Automation, or biology, chemistry is preferable.
* University degree in a technical field (physics, optics, precision mechanics, electronics, chemistry, etc.), or a combination of education and experience that demonstrates the required skills
* Identify, recommend and prioritize improvements to the customer experience, as well as internal process improvements and work with appropriate internal & external partners to implement
* Delta V or other control software experience is a plus.
* Outstanding teammate, who can work with counterparts and customers across the world.
* Self-motivated, self-starter with strong communication skills.
* Sophisticated knowledge of Microsoft Windows operating systems, PC hardware and desktop application products.
* Well oral and written English skill.
* Able and willing to travel extensively.
* Minimum of two years of experience in cell culture, fluorescence microscopy, flow cytometry and other relevant techniques desired

title: Test Automation and Software Test Engineer
description:
Our client in the automotive industry is currently seeking a skilled **Test Automation and Software Test Engineer** to join their dynamic team. This role plays a critical part in ensuring the quality and reliability of advanced driver assistance systems (ADAS) and autonomous driving functions.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Develop and maintain integration test suites for Continuous Integration (CI) pipelines.
* Create and manage automation frameworks for verifying ADAS, autonomous driving functions, and sensors such as Radar, Lidar, and Camera.
* Define test plans and develop test cases for various environments, including HIL (Hardware-in-the-Loop), boxcar, and full vehicle testing.
* Conduct tests on self-developed software and system-level functionalities, ensuring comprehensive coverage.
* Manage multiple projects and releases, tracking what to test, when, and in which test environment.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and fix bugs in the CI pipeline, and provide fault analysis and root cause determination.
* Develop dashboards to track Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and ensure traceability.
* Document tests in CarWeaver and maintain up-to-date records.

**Qualifications:**

* Excellent Python programming skills with a strong object-oriented approach.
* Solid knowledge of Pytest and experience with Robot Framework.
* Proficiency in HIL and SIL environments with experience in simulation tools like dSPACE.
* Familiarity with communication protocols such as CAN, LIN, and Ethernet.
* Experience with Vector tools such as CANoe, CANalyzer, and other relevant tools like Zuul, XCP, and DLT logging.
* Strong experience with data visualization tools like Grafana, PowerBI, or similar.

**Preferred Skills:**

* Background in the automotive industry with a proactive, self-driven approach to project management.
* Experience configuring and maintaining Jenkins/Zuul.
* Familiarity with Linux/QNX operating systems and proficiency in shell scripting.
* Proficiency in C++ and C programming languages.
* Experience with Simulink.

**Desired Attributes:**

* Ability to solve problems both independently and through effective team collaboration.
* Strong communication skills to articulate complex issues clearly and effectively.

title: Mechanical Engineer - Product Improvement
description:
Application Deadline: Sept. 30, 2024 Ängelholm On-site  



Mechanical Engineer - Product Improvement


The Koenigsegg R&D team is a small, agile hub of highly talented individuals, where the sum is greater than the parts. Koenigsegg is committed to hiring and developing top talent from across the world for any given discipline. Our world-class team operates with a non-conventional, ‘Lean Development’ philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels. You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate.



For this role, we are looking for someone with a genuine passion for engineering the best vehicles in the world. You will be working in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial company, leading the way in the hypercar business. You’ll work alongside accomplished, world-renowned engineers on perhaps the most exciting automotive programs in existence today. You will become a member of the Product Improvement group in the Koenigsegg Engineering team.


**THE ROLE**



As a Mechanical Engineer in the Product Improvement team, you will have the opportunity to use knowledge from various areas, to develop robust, proven, and reliable products utilizing the latest automotive technologies.



The role requires good cooperation with other departments and involves research and solution development, problem-solving, root cause analysis, testing, and 3D and 2D documentation preparation. You get a chance to not only develop the design but also coordinate other departments’ activities leading to a resolution of a problem and to participate in its testing, both off- and on the vehicle.



Mechanical engineer will collaborate closely with production, aftermarket, prototype, technical documentation, quality, ME, electrical, as well as CAE, and compliance departments.



You will:


* Work with problem-solving, root cause analysis, and solution development
* Coordinate actions leading from problem investigation to final solution implementation
* Ensure ownership from stakeholders leading to high-quality output
* Design components, assemblies and perform necessary design verification and calculations
* Create 3D models, assemblies, and 2D drawings using Catia V5/3dexperience
* Support the release of product into production (PLM)
* Work closely with Aftermarket, Technical Documentation, Production, and Prototype departments
* Plan, organize and carry out tests to verify component function and requirements
* Ensure technical support leading to successful introduction of solutions into production
* Prepare service kits and service actions
Interact with suppliers and technology providers  
* 

**WHAT WE OFFER**


* Flexible work schedules + culture of collaboration
* Rare opportunity to impact a growing company, backed by Koenigsegg’s long track record of success and profitability
* Engaging and friendly work environment, guided by leadership with a strong vision
* Work alongside world-class talent in tech and automotive
* Quick decision-making

  
Skills & Requirements


**REQUIREMENTS:**


* B.Sc. / M.Sc. in Mechanical Engineering, Mechatronics, or a related field
* Strong interpersonal, communication, and team collaboration skills
* Experience in Mechanical Engineering development role (minimum 4 years), preferably in the automotive sector
* Knowledge and understanding of general mechanical engineering principles and calculation methods: tolerance analysis, mechanical components selection and calculation, material choice and strength, engineering fits
* Design experience using CAD software (minimum 3 years), good knowledge of Catia V5 / 3dexperience will be an additional benefit
* Experience with PLM systems
* Experience with 2D documentation creation with a practical implementation of Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing (minimum 3 years)
* Practical knowledge of manufacturing technologies used for prototyping and low-volume production in the automotive industry
Fluency in English including technical terminology  
* 

**Desirable Skills:**


* *FEM analysis skills*
* *Knowledge of electronics and HV systems*
* *Ability to read and understand electrical schematics*
* *Understanding of vehicle systems construction and operation*
* *Experience with data logging and analysis*
* ***Embedded software programming exposure/experience***
* ***Experience with communication protocols***
* ***Hands-on experience with cars – both from software/electronics as well as hardware perspective***


Your way of working:


* Proactive, flexible, and self-motivated
* Self-driven
* Well-organized and structured with the ability to drive things to completion
* Capable of working cross-functionally


***Please send the application form in English.***


Great Place to Work


Opportunity to impact a growing company


Work alongside world-class talent


Flexible work schedules + Culture of collaboration


Long track record of success and profitability


Engaging and sharing work environment


Quick decision making, flat hierarchy


About the company


Koenigsegg is most known for building some of the fastest cars in the world; with almost all of our megacar technologies that are patented and made in-house by our almost 500 world-class technicians, engineers, sourcing experts, production craftsmen, and communicators.


What we’ve created is a unique proving ground of engineering creativity that makes use of our breakthrough megacar development and legacy to push the boundaries of sustainable mobility technology.



So, what’s next?


We are on a universe-denting mission to develop the next generation of breakthrough tech and products. We are looking for outstanding, impactful, and authentic individuals to grow with us. Our ambitions are inspiring but will push the limits of what is possible – requiring one to work efficiently amid our cross-functional teams to execute at high-quality levels.


**The goal is clear: innovate and transform.**

title: Cybersecurity Engineer
description:
Are you ready to make electrifying connections? Help us to design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of the Volvo Group Technology team, you’ll help us accelerate our journey by engineering exciting next-gen technologies with a global reach. Be part of our evolution as we strengthen our team. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact.  

  

**Shaping tomorrow’s technology**  

At Vehicle Technology, we are passionate about shaping tomorrow’s technology to create excellent sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions to make the world a better place for future generations. We provide innovative, safe and driver friendly solutions, we develop top quality services, and we make our customer operations more efficient by using excellent data insights. We support the Volvo Group engineering community with cutting edge tools and methods

**Who are we?**


Safe & Efficient Driving is one of the technology streams within Volvo Technology. Our mission is to increase safety for our drivers and other road users as well as support our customers to operate their fleets in the most efficient way.

**About the role:**


This role is within SED data & Release sub stream and your responsibility will be securing the implementation of the cybersecurity risk management frameworks and methodologies for the Safe & Efficient Driving products, the analysis and consolidation of the organization’s quality and risk management practice, you will communicate, present and report to relevant stakeholders, you will contribute in building a cybersecurity risk-aware environment.


You will report to the Global Technology Manager and will be part of a global management team in Gothenburg and Bangalore.

 **Who are you?**


To be successful in this position you need to be a team player with strong collaboration/networking skills and have an analytic mindset of a true problem solver. You also need to be open-minded, self-motivated, and meticulous with independent critical thinking in your problem-solving approach. You have experience from Cyber Security in automotive industry, system development, software development with great attitude and willingness to learn and take more responsibility with time in practical automotive applications.

**Qualifications and requirements:**


You have worked with identification and management of cyber security risks and development of security requirements including monitoring and detection of cyber security attacks.  

  

In addition, we believe you have the following:

* Master of Science in Computer engineering, electrical engineering and Electronics engineering or similar.
* Understanding of upcoming Cyber Security regulations (UNECE R155) and standards (ISO/SAE 21434 Road vehicles — Cybersecurity engineering)
* Experience from performing Threat Analysis and Risk Assessment and have been part of the Cyber security concept phase
* Understanding of challenges within ADAS product development and validation (functional safety, SOTIF, data management and similar) is a merit


Join us if you're ready to be a driving force in our team's success, bringing innovation and excellence to the forefront of our operations.

**Ready for the next move?**


Apply now and join us if you're ready to be a driving force in our team's success, bringing innovation and excellence to the forefront of our operations.


For further details and questions, contact the hiring manager, Rached Dardouri, at: rached.dardouri@volvo.com

 **Last application date: 26th September 2024**

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group.** Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Group Trucks Technology** are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Teknisk projektledare till kund i Örebro
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



**Är du en ledare som får saker att hända, samtidigt som du lyfter fram dina kollegor? Har du förmågan att skapa en helhet från detaljer? Sigma Industry växer så det knakar! Vi söker drivna ledare som vill följa med oss på en spännande resa framåt. Just nu letar vi kanske efter dig?**



Söker vi dig?



På Sigma kan du arbeta i spännande projekt hos några av de världsledande företagen inom fordonsindustrin. För att trivas i din roll tror vi därför att du är bekväm med att arbeta i en tvärfunktionell global organisation samt att du har god kommunikationsförmåga i båda svenska och engelska. Som ledare inom teknikutveckling följer du en produkt genom olika delar av dess cykel, varför det är viktigt att du är flexibel och är en god ledare. Vi söker dig med rätt tänkesätt som vill göra skillnad inom vår och kundens organisation.



Vi tror att du är:


* En ingenjör som redan har arbetat några år som teknisk projektledare eller i liknande roller inom produktutveckling.
* Pratar och skriver flytande svenska och engelska
* Erfarenhet från agilt drivna projekt, SAFe / Scrum


Erfarenheter från tex: fordonsindustri, hårdvara / mjukvara, högspänning, batterifordon är stark meriterande.



Låter det här som du? 



Söker du oss?



Hos oss blir du välkomnad av glada och hjälpsamma kollegor. Vi har roligt på jobbet, högt i tak och ett engagerande klimat. Du står aldrig ensam inför en utmaning utan kan bolla idéer och hitta möjligheter tillsammans med dina kollegor.



Som konsult på Sigma ges du möjlighet att verka inom en rad olika branscher, där du antingen är på plats hos kund eller på Sigmas kontor via satellit- och in-houseprojekt. Vi har bland annat projekt inom fordonsindustrin, Life Science, låsindustrin, konsumentprodukter, livsmedel och elektrifiering. Vi bryter ständigt mark inom nya, spännande områden.
